definition: arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: Store conditions of extra narrow veins are complex.
sentences.chinese: 极薄矿脉赋存条件复杂。

sentences.english: Where you have water ice, you have a potential mother lode for lunar prospecting of hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 存在水冰的地方都存在着一个月球氢勘探的矿脉。

sentences.english: Haixi and Yanshan periods are important time for mineralization of gold.
sentences.chinese: 不同构造中的金矿脉是不同期成矿作用的产物。

sentences.english: One type lives five miles deep in the bowels of South African gold mines.
sentences.chinese: 其中一种生活在五英里深的南非黄金矿脉里。

sentences.english: The research is of great reference significance to the mining of the gently inclined and thin ore vein.
sentences.chinese: 其研究结果对缓倾斜极薄矿脉的开采具有重要意义。

sentences.english: The metalliferous ore that fills a fissure in a rock formation.
sentences.chinese: 矿脉在固体结岩中用于填充裂缝的金属矿床。

sentences.english: We discovered the rich lode bellied out.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现丰富的矿脉突然增大了。

sentences.english: A level in a mine driven so that it intersects a vein of ore.
sentences.chinese: 石门，横巷矿井内掘出的平巷，它与矿脉相交。

sentences.english: It was the first, and one of the largest, diamond Pipes in the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 它是前苏联第一处也是最大的钻石矿脉。

sentences.english: The Boundary of vein and surrounding rock is clear. The thickness of orebodies changes a lot.
sentences.chinese: 矿脉与围岩界线清楚，矿体厚度变化较大。

sentences.english: The kidneys depend on water to operate efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 我们的肾型矿脉依赖水来正常工作。

definition: to extract (ore or other resource from a mine)/to exploit/to mine
Lingshi county in Jinzhong 晉中|晋中[Jin4 zhong1], Shanxi
